text:
Since the natural log, In, of ex is x, we can get the continuously compounded rate from
an effective annual rate by using the In calculator function. Using our previous example,
In (1 + 10.517%) = In 1.105171 = 10%. Verify this by entering 1.105171 in your
calculator and then entering the In key. (Using the HP calculator, the keystrokes are
1.105171 [g] [[n].)
